plugins.name: Sizr
plugins.description: Sizr is a Figma plugin designed to streamline the process of resizing elements within a frame. By leveraging the column grid layout of the parent frame, the plugin ensures precise alignment and proportional scaling of selected elements. Whether you’re working with rectangles, text layers, groups, or components, Column Sizr dynamically calculates the appropriate dimensions based on the grid’s column count, margins, and gutter size. Simply select your elements, define the desired number of columns, and let the plugin handle the rest. Ideal for designers aiming for consistency and accuracy in grid-based designs.
plugins.tagline: Resize elements dynamically based on the column grid of their parent frame.

111068.name: Sizr
111068.description: Sizr is a Figma plugin designed to streamline the process of resizing elements within a frame. By leveraging the column grid layout of the parent frame, the plugin ensures precise alignment and proportional scaling of selected elements. Whether you’re working with rectangles, text layers, groups, or components, Column Sizr dynamically calculates the appropriate dimensions based on the grid’s column count, margins, and gutter size. Simply select your elements, define the desired number of columns, and let the plugin handle the rest. Ideal for designers aiming for consistency and accuracy in grid-based designs.
111068.release_notes:
Support for Components
Added:
- The plugin now supports resizing elements based on the grid of a parent `COMPONENT` in addition to a `FRAME`.
- Automatically detects whether the parent is a `FRAME` or `COMPONENT` with a valid grid layout.
- Displays appropriate notifications if resizing is restricted (e.g., when dealing with a master component).

Fixed:
- Improved error handling and user feedback for unsupported parent types or missing grid layouts.

How to Use:
1. Select an element within a `FRAME` or `COMPONENT` with a grid.
2. Trigger the plugin to resize compatible elements based on the grid layout.
111068.tagline: Resize elements dynamically based on the column grid of their parent frame.

plugins.name: batchy
plugins.description:
batchy is a helper tool to make your exports more comfortable. Instead of just using the layer name and getting the layer size, you will now be able to write your own asset name dynamically with the help of export tokens and choosing between layer size or screen size for your assets.


Features

  1. dynamic asset names with several export tokens like: layers, date, file, scaling, index, user, top-level frame name,
  2. export assets in layer or screen size (top-level frame)
  3. export your current selection
  4. export from an asset list
  5. date formats for your naming
  6. export in common file formats like png, jpg, svg, pdf
  7. multiple files will be downloaded as a zip, single files will be downloaded as single files
  8. OS-proofed asset name support
plugins.tagline: Export your designs with dynamic name behaviors.

**Bug fixes**

plugins.name: Screen Counter
plugins.description:
Tired of manually counting screens in your Figma file? Meet Screen Counter, your new best friend for quick and intelligent screen counting!


✨ Here’s what it can do:

  1. Count selected screens in just a click – no more eye strain or second guessing.
  2. Add prefixes (like login, home, product) to group screens with similar flows or purposes.
  3. If multiple screens share the same prefix, we’ll count them as 1 (because duh, they’re basically twins).
  4. If you don’t add a prefix, we’ll count each screen individually, as they should be!


Simple, clear, and a little smarter than your average screen counter.


🖱️ Select → Prefix → Count → Done.


Try it now and turn screen chaos into clean counts!
plugins.tagline: Count Smarter, Not Harder!

plugins.name: TokenBoard
plugins.description:
TokenBoard is an advanced Figma plugin designed to give you full visibility and control over local variable collections — whether you’re building a robust design system, managing light/dark modes, or maintaining consistent styles across teams.


Features Overview


Explore Variables by Collection, Scope & Mode

  1. Browse all local variable collections in your Figma file
  2. Organized as expandable tree structures by collection, group, and nested groups
  3. View and compare values across all modes (e.g. “Light”, “Dark”)


Smart Search

  1. Instant full-text search across variable names, values, types, and scopes
  2. Highlights matches inside nested groups
  3. Keeps scroll position and selection while typing


Visual & Semantic Display

  1. Color tokens show live swatches, hex values, and opacity
  2. Boolean, number, string tokens are clearly labeled
  3. Aliases display as links to target variables with inline previews


Aliases & References

  1. Displays alias chains with resolved values
  2. Clickable interface to explore alias references
  3. Supports setting or detaching aliases via selector popup


Inline Editing of Values

  1. Edit most values directly inside the table: Colors (rgba), Strings, Numbers, Booleans, Aliases
  2. Shows validation states and editable highlights
  3. Supports editing multiple modes in a variable


Selection-Aware Variable Inspector

  1. Automatically detects all variables applied to the selected node(s) on the canvas
  2. Displays them grouped by collection, scope, and mode
  3. Resolves and highlights any aliases used
  4. Handles nested selections and multiple nodes
  5. Edit Values Directly from the Selection
  6. Selection-based variable data is cached with a unique key
  7. Improves performance when switching between nodes
  8. Cache is auto-expired after 5 minutes or can be manually refreshed


Batch Update

  1. Send a list of changes (e.g. 30+ variable updates) in one click
  2. Type conversion (color objects, strings, aliases)
  3. Font loading for FONT_FAMILY variables (with fallback to alternative styles if “Regular” not available)
  4. Scope checks and error recovery per variable
  5. Returns a report of successful and failed updates


Performance Optimizations

  1. In-memory caching of selection data with expiry (5 min)
  2. Caches up to 50 different selections to reduce API calls
  3. Tracks which variables are already loaded to avoid duplication


Figma API Compatibility Handling

  1. Graceful fallback if variable APIs or methods are unavailable
  2. Error messages guide user to fix or retry


Clean, Resizable UI

  1. Fully styled native-like UI with Figma theme support (light/dark)
  2. Flexible layout with resizable panel
  3. Displays progress during data load
  4. Empty states and error messages styled for clarity


Ideal Use Cases

  1. Design system audits
  2. Token cleanup and maintenance
  3. Visual QA of theme modes
  4. Alias linking and optimization
  5. Batch updates to variable values
  6. Color or typography token management


Compatibility

  1. Built for the latest Figma API with full variable support
  2. Works in Figma files only (not FigJam)
  3. Requires Variables feature enabled in your Figma workspace

accepted.name: Andrei Kuznetsov
accepted.description: Templates, UI Kits, Design Systems, Plugins

plugins.tagline: Advanced Figma plugin for browsing, editing, and batch-managing local variables, modes, and aliases

plugins.name: Gradientify
plugins.description:
Bring vibrant, layered gradients into your Figma designs. With this plugin, you can:


  1. Generate random gradients with an optional noise effect
  2. Paste CSS code from gradientify.app to apply gradients to layers
  3. Use gradients as fill properties for easy customization


Free trial

Try it out up to 5 times in each mode (random generation and CSS import), or unlock unlimited use with a license key.

plugins.name: Markdown Import
plugins.description:
このプラグインは、Google Docsやメモ帳などからコピーしたマークダウン形式のテキストを、Figmaのページ内にインポートするツールです。

「# 見出し1 」「 ## 見出し2」「### 見出し3」「本文」の構造を自動で判別し、それぞれに対応するコンポーネントを選択して挿入することができます。


【主な機能】

  1. マークダウン記法でコピー＆ペースト → 自動でレイアウト生成
  2. 見出し1〜3、本文、それぞれに同一ページ内の任意のコンポーネントを割り当て可能
  3. コンポーネント内のテキストレイヤーを自動で認識し、文字を置換


---


This plugin lets you import markdown-style text into your Figma page directly from Google Docs, Notepad, or any markdown editor.


It automatically parses the structure of your content—such as # Heading 1, ## Heading 2, ### Heading 3, and body text —and allows you to assign custom components for each section during import.


【Key Features】

  1. Paste markdown-formatted text and auto-generate layout in Figma
  2. Assign your preferred components for headings (H1–H3) and body text
  3. Detect and replace text inside the designated layer of each component
plugins.tagline: マークダウンのテキストをコンポーネントを適用してインポート | Import markdown into Figma with component mapping.

plugins.name: SaveFrame - Save, Share, and Manage Custom Frames with Ease.
plugins.description:
SaveFrame — Figma Frames, Re imagined!


Tired of Figma’s default frame window? SaveFrame is your modern visual command center for everything frames.

Custom frames, Organize, preview, customize, delete, and share—like never before.


Whether you're documenting designs, building moodboards, or curating visual systems, SaveFrame gives you full creative control. It's what Figma frames should feel like.


✨ Why designers love SaveFrame:


🔍 Instant Frame Previews

  1. No more clicking around. See all your frames at a glance in a clean, scrollable UI.

🧩 Drag & Drop Organization

  1. Sort, group, and build collections effortlessly. Your canvas, your logic.

🧹 Smart Deletion

  1. Clear out what you don’t need—instantly. Delete single frames or full sets with confidence.

📐 Save All the Details

  1. Dimensions, effects, layout, constraints—SaveFrame remembers the stuff that matters.

🎨 Reusable Frame Presets

  1. Create your own frame styles and apply them in one click. Keep your design patterns consistent.

🚀 Seamless Sharing

  1. Export and import frame collections in seconds.
  2. Perfect for sharing with teammates or individuals—no friction, no confusion.

⭐ Favorite Key Frames

  1. Highlight your best work and access it instantly when it counts.

🌗 Light & Dark Mode

  1. A workspace that adapts to your vibe, day or night.



🛠 Built for designers who:

  1. Want more control than Figma gives out of the box
  2. Create and manage multiple frames daily
  3. Build moodboards, docs, and design systems
  4. Hate clutter and love visual clarity
  5. Need a fast way to share organized frames with collaborators


In short:

We took the idea of Figma frames and made it flexible, collaborative, and creator-first.

SaveFrame isn’t just a tool—it’s a better way to work with frames.
plugins.tagline: Figma Frames, Reimagined — Save, Share, and Manage Custom Frames with Ease.

plugins.name: 图形透视变换 Perspective Transform
plugins.description:
介绍

图形透视变换是一个强大的 Figma 插件，专为设计师打造，帮助您轻松实现矢量图形的透视变形。通过直观的界面和灵活的控制，您可以快速调整图形的四个角点，创造出专业级的设计效果。


功能说明

  1. 实时透视调整：通过拖动四个角点，实时调整矢量图形的透视效果。
  2. 精确控制：基于相对比例定位，确保变形的精准性和一致性。
  3. 自动更新：选择新的图形时，插件自动重新计算并定位角点。
  4. 重置功能：一键恢复图形到初始状态，方便反复调整。
  5. 兼容多种图形：支持矩形及简单的四边形矢量图形。


使用方法

  1. 在 Figma 中选择一个矩形或四边形矢量图形。
  2. 运行透视变换（专业版）插件。
  3. 在插件界面中，拖动四个角点以调整图形的透视效果。
  4. 点击“重置”按钮可将图形恢复到原始状态。
  5. 观察 Figma 中的图形实时更新，直至达到满意的设计效果。


注意事项

  1. 仅支持简单的四边形路径，复杂路径可能无法正确解析。
  2. 在使用插件前，建议备份原始图形以防止数据丢失。
  3. 插件当前版本不支持曲线或多路径的矢量图形。
  4. 确保 Figma 已更新到最新版本，以获得最佳使用体验。


Introduction

Perspective Transform Pro is a powerful Figma plugin designed for designers to effortlessly achieve perspective transformations on vector graphics. With an intuitive interface and flexible controls, you can quickly adjust the four corner points of your graphics to create professional-grade design effects.


Function Description

  1. Real-Time Perspective Adjustment: Manipulate the four corner points to adjust the perspective of vector graphics in real-time.
  2. Precise Control: Based on relative proportions, ensuring accuracy and consistency in transformations.
  3. Automatic Updates: Automatically recalculates and repositions corner points when selecting new graphics.
  4. Reset Functionality: One-click reset to restore graphics to their original state for easy adjustments.
  5. Compatibility with Various Shapes: Supports rectangles and simple quadrilateral vector graphics.


How to Use

  1. Select a rectangle or quadrilateral vector graphic in Figma.
  2. Run the Perspective Transform Pro plugin.
  3. In the plugin interface, drag the four corner points to adjust the perspective effect.
  4. Click the "Reset" button to restore the graphic to its original state.
  5. Observe the graphic in Figma updating in real-time until you achieve the desired design effect.


Precautions

  1. Supports only simple quadrilateral paths; complex paths may not parse correctly.
  2. It is recommended to backup original graphics before using the plugin to prevent data loss.
  3. The current version does not support curved or multi-path vector graphics.
  4. Ensure Figma is updated to the latest version for the best user experience.

accepted.name: KingweiCheung
accepted.description: If you have any questions or suggestions, feel free to contact me at kingweichueng@qq.com.

plugins.tagline: Advanced Perspective Transformation for Designers

plugins.name: Figma to Scabld
plugins.description:
Effortlessly Import Your Figma Designs into Scabld!


Transform your designs into mobile apps in no time with the Scabld plugin for Figma. Seamlessly bring your Figma screens into Scabld and move from design to a fully functional mobile app without any coding required. Our plugin automatically adapts your design to Scabld's no-code platform, so you can focus on turning your vision into reality.


How to use this plugin


1. Install the free Figma plugin.

2. Select your Figma designs.

3. Import them directly into Scabld.

4. Continue editing and customizing just like in Figma.

5. Add interactions and animations.

6. Finalize and publish your mobile app with zero code.


With Scabld, skip the hassle of manual conversions. Simply import your Figma files into our no-code platform and turn them into fully functional mobile apps. We preserve your layer names and design structure, making it easy to pick up where you left off and enhance your creations for a smooth user experience.


Preserve your layer structure.

When you import your designs, all your Figma groups and layer names are kept intact. This allows you to refine, adjust, and polish your app directly in Scabld without losing any important details.


Performance and optimization guaranteed.

When you publish with Scabld, we ensure your mobile app is optimized for peak performance across all devices. Every file is tuned for a fast and smooth experience, providing a high-quality result without compromising speed.


To learn more about Scabld and explore our other features, visit scabld.com.
plugins.tagline: Import your Figma designs into Scabld effortlessly.

plugins.name: md格式转设计稿 Markdown to Frame
plugins.description:
Introduction

This plugin allows users to convert Markdown text into fully structured Figma frames automatically, enhancing design workflows and documentation processes.


Function Description

The plugin parses Markdown syntax and creates corresponding Figma frames and text elements, supporting headings, lists, bold text, and horizontal rules. It ensures that all content is visually organized according to Markdown structuring.


Usage Method

Simply input your Markdown text into the provided text area in the plugin’s UI and click the ‘Convert Markdown’ button. The formatted content will appear as structured frames within your current Figma file.


Note

Ensure all text is properly formatted in Markdown before conversion. The frame width is fixed at 500px, but the height will adjust according to the content.


介绍

此插件允许用户将Markdown文本自动转换成完全结构化的Figma框架，增强设计工作流程和文档处理过程。


功能说明

插件解析Markdown语法，并创建相应的Figma框架和文本元素，支持标题、列表、加粗文本和水平规则。它确保所有内容都按照Markdown的结构进行视觉组织。


使用方法

只需在插件的用户界面中提供的文本区域中输入您的Markdown文本，然后点击“转换Markdown”按钮。格式化的内容将以结构化框架的形式出现在您当前的Figma文件中。


注意事项

确保在转换前所有文本都正确格式化为Markdown。框架宽度固定为500px，但高度将根据内容调整。

accepted.name: KingweiCheung
accepted.description: If you have any questions or suggestions, feel free to contact me at kingweichueng@qq.com.

plugins.tagline: Transform Markdown into Structured Figma Frames

plugins.name: Text Harvest
plugins.description:
Text Harvest exports and updates text layers in bulk with a CSV file

Get a quick CSV file from your designs for your copywriting or localization team.


Export

  1. Make a selection or export the entire page if there's no selection
  2. The plugin export only the visible layers, and also ignore the duplicated ones
  3. You'll get a CSV file with layer names and its content
  4. You can skip text layers that you don't want to export by simply adding the symbol "!" at the beginning of the layer name


Update

  1. Make a selection or update the entire page if there's no selection
  2. Select the CSV file
  3. The plugin updates all the layers with the same name


Currently multicolumn CSV are not supported. If you need to translate to different languages, upload an independent CSV for each one

plugins.description:

plugins.name: iMessage AI Chat Builder
plugins.description:
Accelerate your design workflow with an AI-powered plugin that integrates seamlessly with the iMessage Chat Builder UI kit. Use this plugin to instantly generate realistic iMessage screens and prototypes.


Using this plugin will allow you to configure the following chat properties:

  1. The number of chat participants
  2. The maximum number of messages in the chat
  3. Whether iMessage should default to light or dark mode
  4. The conversation topic and tone


Getting Started

To get started, follow these quick steps:


1. Install required fonts and symbols

This plugin uses Apple’s SF Pro and SF Mono font families - in addition to SF Symbols.


These fonts are not bundled with this file. SF Pro should now work natively within Figma’s desktop client, but you’ll still need to download and install SF Mono manually if you haven’t already done so.


2. Generate and enter an Anthropic API key

To use the plugin - you’ll need an Anthropic API key.


You can get one by:

  1. Visiting the Anthropic Console
  2. Signing in or creating an account
  3. Navigating to the API Key section of your account settings
  4. Clicking ‘Create Key’


Paste that API key into the plugin when prompted. Your key is stored locally and never shared.


Note: Anthropic may charge for API usage. Review Anthropic’s API pricing before proceeding with plugin use.


---


This plugin is not affiliated with or endorsed by Apple Inc, Figma Inc, or Anthropic PBC.

accepted.name: Pat Dugan
accepted.description: Front front, back back, sucker grab a snack pack.

plugins.name: Slide Auto-Numbering by Works.
plugins.description:
Slide Auto-Numbering


This plugin automatically numbers your Figma Slides. Wherever a TEXT layer named “page number” exists, it will be overwritten with the correct slide index (1, 2, 3, …).


How to use:

• Ensure each slide has a TEXT layer named “page number.”

• Run the plugin (Plugins → Development → Slide Auto-Numbering → Run).

• The plugin will number the slides linearly in the order provided by Figma Slides.

Set up your Google Gemini API key in Promptus:


Open Promptus inside Figma.

Click the gear icon (Settings) in the top-right corner of the plugin panel.

plugins.name: Find lost local — «Найти потерянные локальные компоненты»
plugins.description:
🔍 Find lost local automatically catches every local instance whose master component lives in another library / document.

Just set a prefix symbol (default “_”) and choose the search scope—current page or whole file.


Features

•Any nesting depth – detects instances hidden inside local components and their masters.

•Page-level grouping – shows how many problematic components each page contains.

•One-click jump – selects and zooms to the target instance.

•Custom prefix – works with _Tabs, .hidden, -draft, @deprecated, or any symbol you use for local components.


When it helps

•Before publishing a library – make sure no stray local copies remain in the file.

•During a design-system migration – quickly spot legacy components that still point elsewhere.

•While reviewing external files – instantly see what is pulled from external libraries.


How to use

1.Open the plugin and, if needed, change the prefix symbol.

2.Pick Current page or Whole file and click Search.

3.Review the grouped list. Clicking a component name jumps to its first found instance.

4.Items labelled “Outside pages” exist only inside master components; fix them in the corresponding library.


The plugin works entirely inside Figma—no internet access required, and no data ever leaves your account.


🔍 Find lost local автоматически вылавливает в вашем файле любые локальные инстансы, мастеры которых живут в другой библиотеке / документе.

Достаточно указать символ-префикс (по умолчанию — «_») и выбрать область поиска — текущую страницу или весь файл.


Возможности

  1. Любая глубина вложенности: находит инстансы, спрятанные внутри локальных компонентов и их мастеров.
  2. Группировка по страницам с подсчётом, сколько проблемных компонентов найдено на каждой.
  3. Переход одним кликом: выбирает и фокусирует нужный инстанс.
  4. Настраиваемый префикс: работает не только с «_Tabs», но и с «.hidden», «-draft», «@deprecated» — любым символом, который вы используете для локальных компонентов.


Когда пригодится

  1. Перед публикацией библиотеки — убедитесь, что в файле нет «висящих» локальных копий.
  2. Во время миграции компонентов из старой дизайн-системы в новую.
  3. При ревью сторонних файлов, чтобы сразу увидеть, что тянется из внешних библиотек.


Как пользоваться

  1. Откройте плагин и при необходимости поменяйте символ-префикс.
  2. Выберите Текущая страница или Весь файл и нажмите Поиск.
  3. Изучите сгруппированный список. Клик по названию компонента перенесёт вас к первому найденному инстансу.
  4. Компоненты, отмеченные как «Вне страницы», находятся только внутри мастеров — их можно исправить в контексте соответствующей библиотеки.


Плагин не требует интернет-доступа и не отправляет данные за пределы вашего аккаунта Figma.
plugins.tagline: Find all local component instances whose master lives in another file

plugins.name: FontMaster - Switch every font in one click
plugins.description:
✨ Take control of your typography in Figma — instantly.


FontMaster scans your selected frames or artboards and lists every font used in your design. With an intuitive interface, you can preview and replace any or all fonts across your selection in just a few clicks. Whether you're managing design systems or updating brand fonts, FontMaster ensures consistency without the manual hassle.


🛠️ How to Use

  1. Run the plugin – FontMaster will automatically detect all fonts used in your selection.
  2. Browse detected fonts – View a list of all text styles and fonts present.
  3. Choose a new font – Pick a replacement font for each one or apply one font to all.
  4. Apply changes – Click “Apply” and FontMaster updates everything instantly.


✅ Why Use FontSwap?

  1. Detects all fonts in seconds
  2. Bulk replace fonts with one click
  3. Perfect for design clean-up, brand updates, and system consistency
  4. Saves time on every project

plugins.name: Sustainalyzer
plugins.description:
Sustainalyzer helps you evaluate the ecological impact of your Figma designs. It detects design elements that conflict with the Web Sustainability Guidelines (WSG) and scientific research on digital sustainability.


The plugin checks for the following sustainability issues:


  1. Avoid videos, particularly autoplay or background media
  2. Minimize image use, especially large or excessive images
  3. Optimize images for size, format, and scaling
  4. Avoid third-party services (e.g. embeds, maps, social widgets)
  5. Avoid decorative elements that add visual weight without purpose
  6. Limit font variants to reduce font file size
  7. Prefer system fonts over custom fonts
  8. Reduce complexity by limiting the number of elements
  9. Disable animation autoplay to reduce processor load
  10. Consider older devices, avoiding effects that degrade performance or compatibility
  11. Use a design system to support reuse and reduce redundancy
  12. Choose energy-efficient colors, especially for large UI areas


Each guideline is tagged with an impact level—high, medium, or low—indicating its potential contribution to emissions. You can filter the results by impact level to focus on the most critical issues.


To use Sustainalyzer, simply select the elements you want to analyze and run the plugin.
plugins.tagline: Check your designs for sustainability issues based on the Web Sustainability Guidelines.
